name: Kled

sources.import_notes: Generated baseline canonical champion file from From Online dataset.

notes: Ability effects are intentionally minimal placeholders until scripted modeling is added.

passive.name: Skaarl the Cowardly Lizard
passive.description: Innate:  Kled rides his semi-trusty steed,  Skaarl, whom takes damage for him while he is Mounted. When  Skaarl's health depletes, Kled dismounts,  cleansing from all  crowd control.
passive.description_source:
Kled and  Skaarl's health bar is split in two segments, representing each of them respectively.
While Mounted, Kled's health is visually rounded up while  Skaarl's health is rounded down.
While Dismounted, Kled's health is visually rounded down while  Skaarl's health is rounded up.
Excess damage dealt to  Skaarl counts for the purposes of effects based on damage dealt (eg.  Death's Dance's Ignore Pain,  Stormsurge's Stormraider, item damage trackers).(note)
If  Skaarl's health is reduced below 0 by an attack or ability with multiple damage instances, subsequent damage instances from the same cast instance are reduced to 0 damage.
 The Collector's Death is special cased to not affect Kled while he is Mounted, regardless of the duo's combined current health.
If  Skaarl's health is reduced below 0 by  Eclipse's Ever Rising Moon, Kled will take the triggering attack's damage.(note)
While  untargetable, Kled rapidly  destroys enemy projectiles targeting him.
Kled's  gameplay radius does not change when becoming Mounted or Dismounted, even though his model size changes visually.
Kled does not receive damage from  Illaoi's  Test of Spirit,  Kayn's  Umbral Trespass, or being  Regurgitated by  Tahm Kench while dismounting.(bug)
Dismounting removes  Speed Shrine's movement speed buff from Kled and prevent him from regaining it for the next 5 seconds, even if he remounts or enters the shrine again.(bug)
The  lunge can pass through  Yorick's  Dark Procession.(bug)
Buying items while Kled and  Skaarl's combined current health is lower than Kled's maximum health will cause Kled to dismount upon undoing the purchase and potentially lose health.(bug)
PENDING FOR TEST: Dismounting with a  spell shield sometimes consumes the spell shield and negates the effects of dismounting.(bug)[2]
If Kled would be  executed while Mounted, he is instead only Dismounted.

basic_ability_1.name: Bear Trap on a Rope
basic_ability_1.description: Active:  Kled throws a bear trap in the target direction that deals physical damage to enemies hit and forms a  tether against the first  champion or  large monster hit,  revealing them.
basic_ability_1.description_source:
Applies  spell damage to enemy champions, large monsters and large pets, while applying  area damage to all other enemy units.
This ability will cast from wherever the caster is at the end of the cast time.
The visual effect of Bear Trap on a Rope will appear at Kled's height at the end of cast time and may not portray its  projectile accurately if Kled is  dismounting at the end of cast time.
PENDING FOR TEST: Is the same true if Kled is  airborne?
In addition to its  projectile, Bear Trap on a Rope will check for enemy champions, large monsters and large pets within a 60-unit center-to-edge radius area from the projectile's origin point.
The projectile interacts with projectile-blocking effects but the area check doesn't.
 Tibbers,  Daisy and  The Maiden are considered  large pets.
All other pets are considered small pets for the purposes of this ability.
Bear Trap on a Rope will not  pull the target if they are in  stasis.
The tether cannot be broken within the first 0.25 seconds of its application.
 Rek'Sai's  Void Rush will break the tether upon the beginning of its cast time.(bug)
The pull damage is updated dynamically based on Kled's current attack damage.
 Count Kledula has no sound cue for when the tether is broken.(bug)
The damage is also increased to 150% against  Neeko disguised as a  ward.

basic_ability_2.name: Violent Tendencies
basic_ability_2.description: Passive:  Kled periodically gains Violent Tendencies, which starts expiring upon his next basic attack.
basic_ability_2.description_source:
Violent Tendencies' bonus damage is applied as a separate damage instance from the attack that triggers it.
This causes  Black Cleaver's Carve to be applied twice.(note)
This damage instance is applied before the damage of the attack.
Violent Tendencies' bonus damage is tagged as  basic damage and  spell damage, which allows it to trigger spell effects.
The bonus damage applies  life steal.
Attacking a plant or  ward will not activate Violent Tendencies.
Attacking either while Violent Tendencies is already active will still consume an attack.
Kled gains attack speed even on non-Violent Tendencies attacks as long as the ability is not on cooldown.
While affected by  Silence or  Forced Actions, the animations and sounds of Kled's first 3 Violent Tendencies attacks are replaced with default ones.(bug)
The first and third attack will  instead play  critical strike animations if they strike critically.
Learning Violent Tendencies will cancel Kled's ongoing attack windup.(bug)
In contrast, Violent Tendencies coming off cooldown during an ongoing attack windup will not cancel it.
Successfully finishing the basic attack will then cause Violent Tendencies to begin expiring, but will not count as one of the 4 attacks.

basic_ability_3.name: Jousting
basic_ability_3.description: Active:  Skaarl  dashes in the target direction, dealing physical damage to enemies she passes through and marking enemy  champions hit. The mark  reveals the target for a short time, during which Jousting can be recast.
basic_ability_3.description_source:
Jousting will go on cooldown at the end of its first dash, but its cooldown cannot be reduced by cooldown refunding effects such as  Transcendence while its mark is active.(bug)
Both casts count as ability activations for the purposes of on-cast effects such as  Spellblade and triggering  Force Pulse's passive.
Casting  Chaaaaaaaarge!!! during Jousting will not interrupt the dash.
The mark is removed at 765 range center-to-edge, which allows Kled to attempt to cast Jousting while outside of maximum range.(bug)
Attempting to recast Jousting while outside of maximum range will make Kled path 550 units in the direction of the mark and consume the mark without casting the ability.
When recasting Jousting,  Skaarl will  Dash to the marked target's location at the time of recasting, then  Dash another 200 units.
The 200 unit dash cannot pass through terrain.
If the marked target's location at the time of recasting happens to be inside terrain, Jousting will end upon reaching terrain.
The speed of the dashes is not updated dynamically during the dash.
The first dash can pass through terrain if Kled is already inside that terrain.
The first dash can enter terrain within a short radius.
This allows Kled to sometimes pass through  Yorick's  Dark Procession with the first cast of Jousting.(bug)
PENDING FOR TEST: the first dash's terrain forgiveness radius
Jousting can be recast even while the target is  untargetable or  dead.
Jousting cannot affect  Neeko disguised as a  ward.(bug)
PENDING FOR TEST: Jousting's hitbox, minion pull direction, speed and range

ultimate.name: Chaaaaaaaarge!!!
ultimate.description: Active: Kled &  Skaarl become  ghosted and  unstoppably charge to a location, building up  bonus movement speed and  shield and leaving a draft in their wake that grants Mr. Kled's Wild Ride to allies that follow the draft.
ultimate.description_source:
During the charge the duo gain (950 − (starting movement speed)) ÷ 12 × (time ÷ 0.25) bonus movement speed
The bonus movement speed is not affected by movement speed caps.
The charge will not give any movement speed to the duo if they have more than [ 1440 raw movement speed ][ 950 after movement speed soft caps ].
The trail will not give Kled and his allies any movement speed out-of-champion-combat if they have more than [ 840 raw movement speed ][ 650 after movement speed soft caps ].
Movement speed is granted by facing the direction of the draft and lasts for 0.528 seconds upon exiting the trail or facing another direction.
 Voidmites, and  Bel'Veth's  Void Remora are considered to be lane  minions for the purpose of Mr. Kled's Wild Ride.
Kled will re-path if his current path is blocked by a newly created terrain (either player created or by the  Mountainous Rift).
The charge will continue towards the target location even if Kled's location changes drastically.
Kled will mark his path with an indicator visible to him and his allies.
Kled's pathing indicator will not account for changes in Kled's pathing.
Kled's pathing indicator will sometimes display a path different from his real path.(bug)[4]
 Axiom Arcanist only increases the first instance of shield gained.(bug)
While charging, if any out of  sight enemy  champions were within 500 range of Kled during the last second, Kled locks on to the closest visible enemy champion within 800 range in his facing direction, and begins dashing toward them.
If Kled passes over the charge's target location, the charge will end even during the dash.(bug)
If the charge ends before, or during the dash, the dash will not:
Generate a shield;
Trail a directional draft, applying Mr. Kled's Wild Ride;
Disable summoner spells and items.
Kled sometimes fails to lock on to valid targets in range.(bug)[5]
 Zeke's Convergence's Frostfire Tempest and  Experimental Hexplate's Overdrive trigger at the end of the charge or at the end of the dash, whichever comes last, even if the charge ends before or during the dash.
Kled and  Skaarl will track the target if they change locations.
They will dash to the target's previous location if the target moves beyond 2500 units of the dash's beginning location.
If the target moves 2500 or more units away from Kled and  Skaarl during the dash, it will be interrupted.
If the dash does not complete within 9 seconds, Kled and  Skaarl will continue to track their target, but will be able to cast spells, and will not be able to collide with enemy champions.
While dashing, Kled will mark his target with an indicator visible to both teams.
The damage dealt is based on time spent traveling before the beginning of the dash.
It is possible for Kled to briefly lose his  crowd control immunity while colliding with an enemy champion, which can cause the  dash, and its subsequent damage and  displacement to be interrupted.(bug)[6]
Chaaaaaaaarge!!!'s  knockback distance and speed may be impeded by terrain.
The  airborne debuff is removed early when the forced movement stops.

Every summoner spell is disabled, but summoner spells that aren't disabled while Kled is charging will not visually appear disabled.(bug)
No summoner spells or items are disabled if the charge ends before or during the dash.(bug)
Buffering Interactions

Nothing can be buffered during the charge.
Movement and attack commands, as well as  Bear Trap on a Rope and  Jousting can be buffered during the dash.
